settingName: Allow users to turn on debugging features
settingDescription: If 'True', permits users to access the debugging features on the device. If 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might prevent users from using the debugging features on the device.
name: SecurityAllowDebuggingFeatures

settingDescription: If 'True', disables Bluetooth entirely on the device. If 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might allow Bluetooth to be used. Available for fully managed, dedicated, and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level). In comparison, Bluetooth configuration disables the user from making changes to the Bluetooth toggle. As a result, it might be either 'On' or 'Off' depending on the state of Bluetooth prior to applying a policy with Bluetooth configuration enabled.
name: BluetoothBlocked

settingName: Block user from turning on unknown sources
settingDescription: If 'True', prevents users from sideloading apps. IfÂ 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might allow users to sideload apps from unknown sources.
name: AppsBlockInstallFromUnknownSources

settingName: Number of passwords required before user can reuse a password
settingDescription: Use this setting to restrict users from creating previously used passwords. Enter the number of previously used passwords that can't be used, from 1-24. For example, enterÂ 5Â so users can't set a new password to their current password or any of their previous four passwords. If the value is blank, Intune doesn't change or update this setting. Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).
name: PasswordPreviousPasswordCountToBlock

settingDescription: Enter the number of lowercase characters the password must have, between 1 and 16 characters. Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).
name: PasswordMinimumLowerCaseCharacters

settingDescription: Enter the number of uppercase characters the password must have, between 1 and 16 characters. Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).
name: PasswordMinimumUpperCaseCharacters

settingName: Number of sign-in failures before wiping device
settingDescription: Enter the number of wrong passwords allowed before the device is wiped, from 4-11. If the value is blank, Intune doesn't change or update this setting. Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).
keywords: SignIn Failure Count Before Factory Reset
name: PasswordSignInFailureCountBeforeFactoryReset

settingDescription: If 'True', blocks all Keyguard lock screen features from being used. If 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, when the device is in lock screen, the OS might allow all the Keyguard features, such as camera, fingerprint unlock, and more. Available for fully managed and dedicated devices.
name: PasswordBlockKeyguard

settingDescription: If 'True', prevents access to the camera on the device. If 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might allow access to the camera. Intune only manages access to the device camera. It doesn't have access to pictures or videos.
name: CameraBlocked

settingDescription: If 'True', prevents screenshots or screen captures on the device. It also prevents the content from being shown on display devices that don't have a secure video output. If 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might let users capture the screen contents as an image.
name: ScreenCaptureBlocked

settingDescription: If 'True', prevents users from configuring Bluetooth on the device. IfÂ 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might allow users to configure Bluetooth.
name: BluetoothBlockConfiguration

settingDescription: If 'True', prevents users from creating or changing any Wi-Fi configurations. IfÂ 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might allow users to change the Wi-Fi settings on the device.
name: WifiBlockEditConfigurations

settingDescription: If 'True', prevents users from using the factory reset option in the device's settings. IfÂ 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might allow external media on the device.
name: FactoryResetBlocked

settingDescription: Enter the minimum number of digits or characters the password must have, from 4 to 16.
name: PasswordMinimumLength

settingName: Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks
settingDescription: Enter the maximum length of time, from 1 minute to 1 hour, that devices can be idle before the screen is automatically locked. Users must enter their credentials to regain access. For example, enter 5 to lock the device after 5 minutes of inactivity. Ignored by device if new time is longer than what's currently set on device. If set to Immediately, devices will use the minimum possible value per device.

options.description: Screen Timeout after 1 Minute of Inactivity
options.name: 1Minute

options.description: Screen Timeout after 5 Minutes of Inactivity
options.name: 5Minutes

options.description: Screen Timeout after 15 Minutes of Inactivity
options.name: 15Minutes

options.description: Screen Timeout after 30 Minutes of Inactivity
options.name: 30Minutes

options.description: Screen Timeout after 1 Hour of Inactivity
options.name: 1Hour

name: passwordMinutesOfInactivityBeforeScreenTimeout

valueOptions.description: Screen Timeout after 1 Minute of Inactivity
valueOptions.name: 1Minute

valueOptions.description: Screen Timeout after 5 Minutes of Inactivity
valueOptions.name: 5Minutes

valueOptions.description: Screen Timeout after 15 Minutes of Inactivity
valueOptions.name: 15Minutes

valueOptions.description: Screen Timeout after 30 Minutes of Inactivity
valueOptions.name: 30Minutes

valueOptions.description: Screen Timeout after 1 Hour of Inactivity
valueOptions.name: 1Hour

Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level). For more details, see the information provided in the âLearn Moreâ section below.

options.description: There must be a password set, but there are no restrictions on type.

settingDescription: Set the passwordâs complexity requirements. Additional password requirements will become available based on your selection. For more details, see the information provided in the âLearn Moreâ section below.

settingDescription: If 'True', disables Bluetooth on the device so that users can't pair with other devices. IfÂ 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might enable Bluetooth on the device.
name: BluetoothBlocked

settingDescription: If 'True', prevents users from transferring files over USB. If 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might allow users to transfer files.
name: StorageBlockUsbFileTransfer

settingName: Number of sign-in failures before wiping device
settingDescription: Enter the number of sign-in attempts allowed, from 4 to 11, before the device is wiped.Â 0Â (zero) might disable the device wipe functionality. When the value is blank, Intune doesn't change or update this setting.
keywords: SignIn Failure Count Before Factory Reset
name: PasswordSignInFailureCountBeforeFactoryReset

settingDescription: Enter the number of symbol characters (&, #, %, and so on) the password must have, between 1 and 16 characters. Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).
name: PasswordMinimumSymbolCharacters

settingDescription: Select how long users have before they're required to unlock the device using a strong authentication method (password, PIN, or pattern). Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).

options.name: REQUIRE_EVERY_DAY
options.displayName: 24 hours since last PIN, password, or pattern unlock

name: PasswordRequireUnlock

valueOptions.name: REQUIRE_EVERY_DAY
valueOptions.displayName: 24 hours since last PIN, password, or pattern unlock

settingDescription: If 'True', prevents users from using or connecting any external media on the device.IfÂ 'False', Intune doesn't change or update this setting. By default, the OS might allow users to connect external media.
name: StorageBlockExternalMedia

settingDescription: Enter the number of non-letters (anything other than letters in the alphabet) the password must have, between 1 and 16 characters. Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).
name: PasswordMinimumNonLetterCharacters

settingDescription: Enter the number of numeric characters (1,Â 2,Â 3, and so on) the password must have, between 1 and 16 characters. Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).
name: PasswordMinimumNumericCharacters

settingDescription: Enter the number of characters the password must have, between 1 and 16 characters. Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).
name: PasswordMinimumLetterCharacters

settingDescription: Enter the minimum number of digits or characters the password must have, between 4 and 16 characters. Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).
name: PasswordMinimumLength

settingName: Number of days until password expires
settingDescription: Enter the number of days, until the device password must be changed, from 1-365. For example, enterÂ 90Â to expire the password after 90 days. When the password expires, users are prompted to create a new password. If the value is blank, Intune doesn't change or update this setting. Available for fully managed, dedicated and corporate-owned work profile devices (at work profile level).
name: PasswordExpirationDays
